isis.stitle: CAB: 4100, 4200, 4300 AND 4400 MODELS - REMOVE - CAB COWL TRAY

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Cowl Tray on Standard Cab, Extended Cab and Crew Cab for all Models before September 2000

step1.para: Unlatch hood on both sides and tilt hood to fully open position.

figure.caption: Figure 115. Cab Cowl Tray on Standard Cab, Extended Cab and Crew Cab for all Models before September 2000

step1.para:
Remove both driver and passenger side windshield wiper arm and blade assembly. Refer to WINDSHIELD WIPER ARM AND BLADE ASSEMBLY
.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 115 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove washer hose (Item 1, view arrow A) from under cowl tray (Item 2, view arrow A) on driver side.
Slide rubber seal (Item 3, view arrow E) off antenna (Item 4, view arrow E) on passenger side.
Remove hex flanged bolt (Item 5, view arrow D) from mounting bracket (Item 6, view arrow D) under cowl tray (Item 2, view arrow D) on passenger side.
Remove torx pan head screw (Item 7, view arrow C) from plastic bracket (Item 8, view arrow C) at the front of cowl tray (Item 2, view arrow C) on passenger side.
Remove hex flanged bolt (Item 9, section A - A) from center mounting bracket (Item 10, section A - A) at the center of cowl tray (Item 2, section A - A).
Remove hex flanged nut (Item 11, view arrow B) from under cowl tray (Item 2, view arrow B) on driver side.
Remove hex flanged nut (Item 12, view arrow D) from under cowl tray (Item 2, view arrow D) on passenger side.

Once all mounting hardware securing cowl tray (Item 2) have been removed, slide the holes in the cowl tray forward off the mounting studs (Item 13) and over both driver and passenger side wiper pivot posts (Item 16).
Lift cowl tray (Item 2) up over the antenna (Item 4) and lay it out of the way and save for installation.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Cowl Tray on Standard Cab, Extended Cab and Crew Cab for all Models after September 2000

step1.para: Unlatch hood on both sides and tilt hood to fully open position.

figure.caption: Figure 116. Cab Cowl Tray on Standard Cab, Extended Cab and Crew Cab for all Models after September 2000

step1.para:
Remove both driver and passenger side windshield wiper arm and blade assembly. Refer to WINDSHIELD WIPER ARM AND BLADE ASSEMBLY
.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 116 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove washer hose (Item 1, view arrow A) from under cowl tray (Item 2, view arrow A) on driver side.
Slide rubber seal (Item 3, view arrow E) off antenna (Item 4, view arrow E) on passenger side.
Remove hex flanged bolt (Item 5, view arrow D) from mounting bracket (Item 6, view arrow D) under cowl tray (Item 2, view arrow D) on passenger side.
Remove torx pan head screw (Item 7, view arrow C) from plastic bracket (Item 8, view arrow C) at the front of cowl tray (Item 2, view arrow C) on passenger side.
Remove hex flanged bolt (Item 9, section A - A) from center mounting bracket (Item 10, section A - A) at the center of cowl tray (Item 2, section A - A).
Remove hex flanged nut (Item 11, view arrow B) from under cowl tray (Item 2, view arrow B) on driver side.
Remove hex flanged nut (Item 12, view arrow D) from under cowl tray (Item 2, view arrow D) on passenger side.

Once all mounting hardware securing cowl tray (Item 2) have been removed, slide the holes in the cowl tray forward off the mounting studs (Item 13) and over both driver and passenger side wiper pivot posts (Item 16).
Lift cowl tray (Item 2) up over the antenna (Item 4) and lay it out of the way and save for installation.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Cowl Tray on Standard Cab, Extended Cab and Crew Cab for all Models after February 2002

step1.para: Unlatch hood on both sides and tilt hood to fully open position.

figure.caption: Figure 117. Cab Cowl Tray on Standard Cab, Extended Cab and Crew Cab for all Models after February 2002

step1.para:
Remove both driver and passenger side windshield wiper arm and blade assembly. Refer to WINDSHIELD WIPER ARM AND BLADE ASSEMBLY
.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 117 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove washer hose (Item 1, view arrow A) from under cowl tray (Item 2, view arrow A) on driver side.
Slide rubber seal (Item 3, view arrow E) off antenna (Item 4, view arrow E) on passenger side.
Remove torx pan head screw (Item 5, view arrow C) from plastic bracket (Item 6, view arrow C) at the front of cowl tray (Item 2, view arrow C) on passenger side.
Remove hex flanged bolt (Item 7, section A - A) from center mounting bracket (Item 8, section A - A) at the center of cowl tray (Item 2, section A - A).
Remove hex flanged nut (Item 9, view arrow B) from under cowl tray (Item 2, view arrow B) on driver side.
Remove hex flanged nut (Item 10, view arrow D) from under cowl tray (Item 2, view arrow D) on passenger side.
Remove washer bottle vent hose (Item 12, view arrow B) from driver side of cowl tray (Item 2, view arrow B) by pulling vent hose push-in fastener (Item 13, view arrow B) out of the cowl tray.

Once the washer bottle vent hose and all mounting hardware securing cowl tray (Item 2) have been removed, slide the holes in the cowl tray forward off the mounting studs (Item 11) and over both driver and passenger side wiper pivot posts (Item 14).
Lift cowl tray (Item 2) up over the antenna (Item 4) and lay it out of the way and save for installation.
